result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
(Cases 21CM236, 21CM365, 21CM380, 21CM435, 21CM467, 21CM469, 21CM614, 21CM1024, 22CF487, 22CM340, 22CM351, 22CM352 are called at 3:30 PM)  Defendant Randal L. Creviston in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Randal L. Creviston.  Attorney Afton Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Defense indicates there is an agreement- recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to 21CM236 Count 1- Domestic Disorderly Conduct, 21CM380 Count 1, Count 2, Count 3- Misdemeanor Bail Jumping. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including 21CM365, 21CM435, 21CM467, 21CM469, 21CM614, 21CM1024, 22CF487, 22CM340, 22CM351, 22CM352. 
Court withhold sentence in 21CM236, 21CM380 Count 1 and orders 12 months Probation with the following conditions: No contact with L.T. or L.T.'s residence, unless and until L.T. requests it be dropped and  the agent approves; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. 
Court orders 104 days jail credit, if revoked. Court orders the agent may end Probation after 6 months if they see fit. 
Court orders in 21CM380 Count 2 and 3- Court orders Defendant to provide DNA sample, pay the surcharge, and Court costs.

Order Denying Defendant's Request 
(Defendant's request dated 06/09/2022)

Arraignment on June 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Dated 05/11/2022, Letter and attachments from defendant to court regarding cases, charges, and bond conditions. 
Received via mail from EC Co. Jail, no indication if copies given to other parties.

Order denying defendant's requests filed 05/16/2022 regarding charges, open cases, and no contact orders.
Per the Court: The State has not moved to dismiss charges. Ms. Thurston does not have the poser to dismiss charges. The charges are still in effect. I will not be responding to future request for the same relief.

1:51 PM case called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randal L. Creviston in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Steuer in court for Randal L. Creviston. 
State raises competency. Defense believes defendant is competent to proceed and challenges probable cause within the complaint. Court reviews criminal complaint. Court does not order competency at this time. 
Defense moves to dismiss Count 1 of the criminal complaint with argument. The State makes argument to support the allegations. Defense responds. Court denies the motion by the Defense. 
The defense makes a statement and Court responds. Parties are ready to proceed with the preliminary hearing. 
2:06 PM State calls Sergeant Chad Strasburg to testify- is sworn and testifies. Cross examination by the Defense. Witness is released. 
State asks for bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over to branch 4 to schedule an ARGN. 
Defense asks for a bond modification- State is not in a position to address bond today.

Correspondence/statements by defendant regarding charges, open cases, and no contact orders.
Received via mail from EC Co. Jail 05/16/2022. No indication if copies given to other parties.

records.addlTxt: SPD Appointment - Attorney Michael Steuer
The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.

(2:19 PM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randal L. Creviston does not appear in court or via Zoom.
State advises the defendant is in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail and refused to come to court today since counsel hasn't been appointed.
State requests the Court find good cause to extend time limits. Court advises finds good cause and extends time limits.
Preliminary Hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
Notice of Assignment of Judge to Defendant. USPS indicates moved left no address; return to sender; unable to forward.
The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.

records.addlTxt:
11:00 AM case called. Court Commissioner Nathan Novak for Branch 5 Intake. Prosecuting attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randal L. Creviston appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Katherine Cook. Defense waives reading of the complaint. Cash bond set. Defendant updates their address. 
State raises competency.  A preliminary hearing is scheduled for 5-10-22 at 1:30 PM.
